intro: Portulaca californica, commonly known as California moss rose, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a low-growing, succulent annual that produces vibrant, showy flowers in shades of red, orange, and yellow. The plant features fleshy, rounded leaves and is well adapted to arid and coastal environments. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and containers. Its ability to survive in harsh conditions makes it an important species in xeriscaping and ecological restoration efforts.
